definitions.definition: A kind of shield , of various shapes and sizes , held in the hand or worn on the arm (usually the left), for protecting the front of the body . In the sword and buckler play of the Middle Ages in England, the buckler was a small shield, used not to cover the body but to stop or parry blows .
A shield resembling the Roman scutum . In modern usage, a smaller variety of shield is usually implied by this term.
One of the large, bony, external plates found on many ganoid fishes.
The anterior segment of the shell of a trilobite .
A block of wood or plate of iron made to fit a hawse hole, or the circular opening in a half-port , to prevent water from entering when the vessel pitches .

secondary_definitions: A kind of shield , of various shapes and sizes , held in the hand or worn on the arm (usually the left), for protecting the front of the body . In the sword and buckler play of the Middle Ages in England, the buckler was a small shield, used not to cover the body but to stop or parry blows .
( obsolete ) A shield resembling the Roman scutum . In modern usage, a smaller variety of shield is usually implied by this term.
( zoology ) One of the large, bony, external plates found on many ganoid fishes.
( zoology ) The anterior segment of the shell of a trilobite .
( nautical ) A block of wood or plate of iron made to fit a hawse hole, or the circular opening in a half-port , to prevent water from entering when the vessel pitches .
